author: robzajac
content:
Question around the spec for light client updates:

> Full nodes SHOULD provide the best derivable LightClientUpdate (according to is_better_update) for each sync committee period covering any epochs in range [max(ALTAIR_FORK_EPOCH, current_epoch - MIN_EPOCHS_FOR_BLOCK_REQUESTS), current_epoch] where current_epoch is defined by the current wall-clock time.

Does this mean strictly that nodes which provide some other LightClientUpdate for a sync committee period (i.e. one that is not the best according to `is_better_update`)  are incorrect? does it compromise the protocol to provide a different update?

author: robzajac
content:
the context is that I don't see a way to track historic LightClientUpdates other than implementing a cache over the retention period (and I see similar discussion from other clients in the history of this channel), but as an approximation of the functionality for testing I thought whether we can implement any other update first, e.g. returning the LCU corresponding to the first slot of the period

in that implementation it suffices to read the beacon state for that slot, rather than build a cache
